stickers.label: Kente
stickers.funFact: Kente is hand-woven by the Ashanti people of Ghana using silk and cotton!

stickers.label: Drum
stickers.funFact: The djembe drum can make over 25 different sounds with just your hands!

stickers.label: Crown
stickers.funFact: The Golden Stool is the symbol of the Ashanti kingdom and is believed to hold the spirit of the nation!

stickers.label: Kente Icon
stickers.funFact: Each colour in a kente pattern has a special meaning — gold means royalty and wealth!

stickers.label: Jollof Bowl
stickers.funFact: Ghana and Nigeria have a friendly rivalry over who makes the best jollof rice!

stickers.label: Flag Badge
stickers.funFact: The black star on Ghana's flag represents African freedom — Ghana was the first African country south of the Sahara to gain independence!

stickers.label: Ghana Flag
stickers.funFact: Ghana's flag has red for the blood of heroes, gold for mineral wealth, and green for forests and farms!

stickers.label: Flag Pin
stickers.funFact: Ghana means 'Warrior King' — it was named after the ancient Ghana Empire!

stickers.label: Accra
stickers.funFact: Accra is Ghana's capital city and sits right on the coast of the Atlantic Ocean!

stickers.label: Black Stars
stickers.funFact: Ghana's football team is called the Black Stars — they've played in the FIFA World Cup three times!

stickers.label: Ghana Kit
stickers.funFact: The Ghana football jersey features the colours of the national flag — red, gold, and green!

stickers.label: Afia Excited
stickers.funFact: Afia loves discovering new things about Ghana — her name means 'born on Friday' in Akan!

stickers.label: Afia Happy
stickers.funFact: In Ghana, people greet each other by asking 'How is the morning?' — it shows you care!

stickers.label: Afia Proud
stickers.funFact: Afia is proud of her Ghanaian heritage — Ghana is known as the 'Gateway to Africa'!

stickers.label: Afia Thinking
stickers.funFact: Did you know? Ghana has over 100 different ethnic groups, each with their own language!

stickers.label: Banku Chef
stickers.funFact: Banku is made from fermented corn and cassava dough — it's soft, sour, and eaten with your hands!

stickers.label: Fried Rice Chef
stickers.funFact: Ghana fried rice is packed with vegetables and seasoned with shito — a spicy black pepper sauce!

stickers.label: Fufu Chef
stickers.funFact: Fufu is pounded from cassava and plantain until it's super smooth and stretchy like dough!

stickers.label: Jollof Chef
stickers.funFact: Jollof rice gets its beautiful orange colour from tomatoes, peppers, and special spices!

stickers.label: Kelewele Chef
stickers.funFact: Kelewele is spicy fried plantain cubes — a favourite street snack sold all over Ghana at night!

stickers.label: Koko Chef
stickers.funFact: Koko is a warm spiced porridge made from millet — it's a popular breakfast in northern Ghana!

stickers.label: Palm Soup Chef
stickers.funFact: Palm nut soup is made from the fruit of the oil palm tree — it's rich, creamy, and bright orange!

stickers.label: Tilapia Chef
stickers.funFact: Grilled tilapia is a beloved Ghanaian dish — often served with banku and hot pepper sauce!

stickers.label: Waakye Chef
stickers.funFact: Waakye is rice and beans cooked with dried millet leaves that turn it a deep reddish-brown colour!

stickers.label: Lady Liberty
stickers.funFact: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France and arrived in 350 pieces packed in 214 crates!

stickers.label: Eagle
stickers.funFact: The bald eagle can spot a rabbit from over 3 kilometres away — that's superhero vision!

stickers.label: Baseball Cap
stickers.funFact: Baseball is called America's pastime — the first official game was played in 1846!

stickers.label: Milkshake
stickers.funFact: The world's largest milkshake was made in New York and was over 6,000 litres!

stickers.label: Ava Excited
stickers.funFact: Ava loves road trips across America — the USA has over 6.5 million kilometres of roads!

stickers.label: Ava Happy
stickers.funFact: Americans eat about 3 billion pizzas every year — that's 100 acres of pizza a day!

stickers.label: Ava Proud
stickers.funFact: The USA has 63 national parks — from the Grand Canyon to Yellowstone's geysers!

stickers.label: Ava Thinking
stickers.funFact: Did you know? The USA is the only country to have put people on the Moon — 12 astronauts walked on it!

stickers.label: Mask
stickers.funFact: Nigerian masks are used in festivals and ceremonies to tell stories of ancestors and spirits!

stickers.label: Drum
stickers.funFact: The talking drum can mimic the tones of spoken Yoruba language — it actually talks!

stickers.label: Ankara
stickers.funFact: Ankara fabric has bold, colourful patterns and every design tells a unique story!

stickers.label: Adetutu Excited
stickers.funFact: Adetutu means 'the crown is gentle' in Yoruba — it's a name fit for royalty!

stickers.label: Adetutu Happy
stickers.funFact: Nigeria is called the 'Giant of Africa' because it has the most people of any African country!

stickers.label: Adetutu Proud
stickers.funFact: Nigeria's film industry, Nollywood, is one of the biggest in the world — making over 2,500 films a year!

stickers.label: Adetutu Thinking
stickers.funFact: Did you know? Nigeria has over 500 different languages spoken across the country!

stickers.label: Big Ben
stickers.funFact: Big Ben's real name is the Elizabeth Tower — Big Ben is actually the nickname of the great bell inside!

stickers.label: Tower Bridge
stickers.funFact: Tower Bridge opens about 800 times a year to let tall ships pass through!

stickers.label: Cup of Tea
stickers.funFact: The UK drinks about 100 million cups of tea every single day!

stickers.label: Royal Crown
stickers.funFact: The Imperial State Crown has 2,868 diamonds, 17 sapphires, 11 emeralds, and 269 pearls!

stickers.label: Union Jack
stickers.funFact: The Union Jack is made up of three crosses — one each for England, Scotland, and Ireland!

stickers.label: Red Bus
stickers.funFact: London's iconic red double-decker buses have been running since 1829!

stickers.label: London Eye
stickers.funFact: The London Eye is 135 metres tall and you can see 40 kilometres from the top!

stickers.label: Phone Box
stickers.funFact: There are about 8,000 red phone boxes left in the UK — many have been turned into mini libraries!

stickers.label: Red Telephone
stickers.funFact: The red telephone box was designed in 1924 and is one of the most recognised symbols of the UK!

stickers.label: Heze & Aza
stickers.funFact: Heze and Aza are twins who love exploring the UK together — Heze loves patterns and Aza loves stories!

stickers.label: Twins Excited
stickers.funFact: The UK is made up of four countries — England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland!

stickers.label: Twins Happy
stickers.funFact: Fish and chips has been a favourite British meal since the 1860s!

stickers.label: Twins Proud
stickers.funFact: The UK invented football, rugby, cricket, and tennis — all played around the world today!

stickers.label: Twins Thinking
stickers.funFact: Did you know? The Tower of London has had ravens living there for over 300 years — legend says if they ever leave, the kingdom will fall!

stickers.label: Storyteller
stickers.funFact: Every great adventure starts with a story — and you just finished your first!

stickers.label: Story Safari
stickers.funFact: Lions are called the kings of the jungle, but they actually live on grasslands called savannas!

stickers.label: Island Tales
stickers.funFact: Coconut palms can grow up to 30 metres tall and live for over 100 years!

stickers.label: Junior Chef
stickers.funFact: You cooked your first dish! Chefs around the world started just like you.

stickers.label: Breakfast Star
stickers.funFact: People have been eating pancakes for over 30,000 years — they're one of the oldest foods!

stickers.label: Sunny Cook
stickers.funFact: The sun is so big that about 1.3 million Earths could fit inside it!

stickers.label: Traveler
stickers.funFact: You packed your very first suitcase! Where will your next adventure take you?

stickers.label: Jet Setter
stickers.funFact: A jumbo jet can fly over 900 kilometres per hour — faster than any bird!

stickers.label: Sky Explorer
stickers.funFact: Clouds can weigh as much as 80 elephants — they float because the air beneath them is even heavier!

stickers.label: Artist
stickers.funFact: Every masterpiece starts with a single colour — and you just created one!

stickers.label: Golden Touch
stickers.funFact: Gold is so soft you can shape it with your hands — and it never rusts or tarnishes!

stickers.label: Creative Star
stickers.funFact: Dancing is one of the oldest art forms — people have been dancing for over 9,000 years!

stickers.label: Brainiac
stickers.funFact: Your brain just levelled up! Quizzes help you learn fun facts about the world.

stickers.label: Happy Learner
stickers.funFact: Smiling is contagious — when you smile at someone, their brain automatically wants to smile back!

stickers.label: Mind Blown
stickers.funFact: Your brain makes about 70,000 thoughts every day — and you just learned something new!

stickers.label: Creator
stickers.funFact: You saved your own artwork! Every famous artist started by drawing and doodling.

stickers.label: Art Lover
stickers.funFact: The heart shape has been a symbol of love for over 800 years!

stickers.label: Purple Star
stickers.funFact: Purple used to be the rarest colour — only kings and queens were allowed to wear it!

stickers.label: Celebration
stickers.funFact: Confetti was invented in Italy — the word means 'little sweets' in Italian!

stickers.label: Ocean Friend
stickers.funFact: Blue whales are the largest animals ever — their hearts are the size of a small car!

stickers.label: Ambulance
stickers.funFact: The first ambulances were horse-drawn carts used over 500 years ago in Spain!

stickers.label: Pilot
stickers.funFact: Pilots fly above the clouds every day — some planes cruise at over 12 kilometres high!

stickers.label: Baseball
stickers.funFact: A baseball has exactly 108 stitches — and every single one is sewn by hand!

stickers.label: Basketball
stickers.funFact: Basketball was invented using a peach basket — someone had to climb a ladder to get the ball out!

stickers.label: Bear
stickers.funFact: Bears can smell food from up to 30 kilometres away — that's like smelling pizza from another town!

stickers.label: Bird
stickers.funFact: There are about 10,000 different species of birds in the world — and they live on every continent!

stickers.label: Boarding Pass
stickers.funFact: The first ever airline ticket was sold in 1914 — the flight lasted just 23 minutes!

stickers.label: Bus
stickers.funFact: The word 'bus' comes from 'omnibus', which means 'for everyone' in Latin!

stickers.label: Carrot
stickers.funFact: Carrots were originally purple, not orange — orange carrots were grown in the Netherlands about 400 years ago!

stickers.label: Compass
stickers.funFact: The compass was invented in China over 2,000 years ago — it always points north because of Earth's magnetic field!

stickers.label: Elephant
stickers.funFact: Elephants are the only animals that can't jump — but they can remember things for decades!

stickers.label: Balloon
stickers.funFact: The first hot air balloon passengers were a sheep, a duck, and a rooster in 1783!

stickers.label: Sky Balloon
stickers.funFact: Hot air balloons float because warm air is lighter than cool air — just like bubbles rising in water!

stickers.label: Flower
stickers.funFact: Sunflowers can grow up to 3 metres tall and always turn their faces towards the sun!

stickers.label: Fox
stickers.funFact: Foxes can hear a watch ticking from 40 metres away — they have incredible super-hearing!

stickers.label: Giraffe
stickers.funFact: Giraffes are the tallest animals on Earth — their tongues alone are 50 centimetres long and purple!

stickers.label: Hospital
stickers.funFact: The first hospitals were built in ancient Rome over 2,000 years ago to help soldiers!

stickers.label: Lion Cub
stickers.funFact: Lion cubs are born with spots that fade as they grow up — just like freckles!

stickers.label: Meadow
stickers.funFact: Meadows are home to hundreds of insects, butterflies, and wildflowers — they're like nature's garden!

stickers.label: Passport
stickers.funFact: The first modern passports were issued during World War I — before that, most people could travel freely!

stickers.label: Puppy
stickers.funFact: Dogs have been our best friends for over 15,000 years — they were the first animals to be domesticated!

stickers.label: PW Plane
stickers.funFact: Welcome aboard the Planet Wonders airline — your next adventure is just a flight away!

stickers.label: School
stickers.funFact: The oldest school in the world is in England — it was founded in the year 597, over 1,400 years ago!

stickers.label: Football
stickers.funFact: Football is the most popular sport in the world — over 4 billion people are fans!

stickers.label: Sparkle
stickers.funFact: Stars twinkle because their light passes through Earth's atmosphere, which bends and wiggles the light around!

stickers.label: Traffic Light
stickers.funFact: The first traffic light was installed in London in 1868 — it was powered by gas and exploded after a month!

stickers.label: Baby Whale
stickers.funFact: A baby blue whale gains about 90 kilograms every day — that's like gaining a whole adult human daily!
